blank:
blank: Rune

Rune with the shape of a blank square
circle:
circle: Rune

Rune with the shape of a circle
corner:
corner: Rune

Rune with black triangle, filling upper right corner
heart:
heart: Rune

Rune with the shape of a heart
nova:
nova: Rune

Rune with the shape of two overlapping triangles, residing in the upper half of the shape
pentagram:
pentagram: Rune

Rune with the shape of a pentagram
rcross:
rcross: Rune

Rune with the shape of a small square inside a large square, each diagonally split into a black and white half
ribbon:
ribbon: Rune

Rune with the shape of a ribbon winding outwards in an anticlockwise spiral
sail:
sail: Rune

Rune with the shape of a sail
square:
square: Rune

Rune with the shape of a full square
triangle:
triangle: Rune

Rune with the shape of a triangle
anaglyph:
anaglyph(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Renders the specified Rune in a tab as an anaglyph. Use 3D glasses to view the anaglyph.
animate_anaglyph:
animate_anaglyph(duration: number, fps: number, func: RuneAnimation) → {AnimatedRune}

Create an animation of anaglyph runes
animate_rune:
animate_rune(duration: number, fps: number, func: RuneAnimation) → {AnimatedRune}

Create an animation of runes
beside:
beside(rune1: Rune, rune2: Rune) → {Rune}

Makes a new Rune from two given Runes by placing the first on the left of the second, both occupying equal portions of the width of the result
beside_frac:
beside_frac(frac: number, rune1: Rune, rune2: Rune) → {Rune}

Makes a new Rune from two given Runes by placing the first on the left of the second such that the first one occupies frac portion of the width of the result and the second the rest
black:
black(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Colors the given rune black (#000000).
blue:
blue(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Colors the given rune blue (#2196F3).
brown:
brown(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Colors the given rune brown.
color:
color(rune: Rune, r: number, g: number, b: number) → {Rune}

Adds color to rune by specifying the red, green, blue (RGB) value, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0. RGB is additive: if all values are 1, the color is white, and if all values are 0, the color is black.
flip_horiz:
flip_horiz(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Makes a new Rune from a given Rune by flipping it around a vertical axis, creating a mirror image
flip_vert:
flip_vert(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Makes a new Rune from a given Rune by flipping it around a horizontal axis, turning it upside down
from_url:
from_url(imageUrl: string) → {Rune}

Create a rune using the image provided in the url
green:
green(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Colors the given rune green (#4CAF50).
hollusion:
hollusion(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Renders the specified Rune in a tab as a hollusion, with a default magnitude of 0.1.
hollusion_magnitude:
hollusion_magnitude(rune: Rune, magnitude: number) → {Rune}

Renders the specified Rune in a tab as a hollusion, using the specified magnitude.
indigo:
indigo(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Colors the given rune indigo (#3F51B5).
make_cross:
make_cross(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Makes a new Rune from a given Rune by arranging into a square for copies of the given Rune in different orientations
orange:
orange(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Colors the given rune orange (#FF9800).
overlay:
overlay(rune1: Rune, rune2: Rune) → {Rune}

The depth range of the z-axis of a rune is [0,-1], this function maps the depth range of rune1 and rune2 to [0,-0.5] and [-0.5,-1] respectively.
overlay_frac:
overlay_frac(frac: number, rune1: Rune, rune2: Rune) → {Rune}

The depth range of the z-axis of a rune is [0,-1], this function gives a [0, -frac] of the depth range to rune1 and the rest to rune2.
pink:
pink(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Colors the given rune pink (#E91E63s).
purple:
purple(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Colors the given rune purple (#AA00FF).
quarter_turn_left:
quarter_turn_left(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Makes a new Rune from a given Rune by turning it a quarter-turn in anti-clockwise direction.
quarter_turn_right:
quarter_turn_right(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Makes a new Rune from a given Rune by turning it a quarter-turn around the centre in clockwise direction.
random_color:
random_color(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Gives random color to the given rune. The color is chosen randomly from the following nine colors: red, pink, purple, indigo, blue, green, yellow, orange, brown
red:
red(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Colors the given rune red (#F44336).
repeat_pattern:
repeat_pattern(n: number, pattern: undefined, initial: Rune) → {Rune}

Applies a given function n times to an initial value
rotate:
rotate(rad: number, rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Rotates a given Rune by a given angle, given in radians, in anti-clockwise direction. Note that parts of the Rune may be cropped as a result.
scale:
scale(ratio: number, rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Scales a given Rune by a given factor in both x and y direction
scale_independent:
scale_independent(ratio_x: number, ratio_y: number, rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Scales a given Rune by separate factors in x and y direction
show:
show(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Renders the specified Rune in a tab as a basic drawing.
stack:
stack(rune1: Rune, rune2: Rune) → {Rune}

Makes a new Rune from two given Runes by placing the first on top of the second, each occupying equal parts of the height of the result
stack_frac:
stack_frac(frac: number, rune1: Rune, rune2: Rune) → {Rune}

Makes a new Rune from two given Runes by placing the first on top of the second such that the first one occupies frac portion of the height of the result and the second the rest
stackn:
stackn(n: number, rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Makes a new Rune from a given Rune by vertically stacking n copies of it
translate:
translate(x: number, y: number, rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Translates a given Rune by given values in x and y direction
turn_upside_down:
turn_upside_down(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Makes a new Rune from a given Rune by turning it upside-down
white:
white(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Colors the given rune white (#FFFFFF).
yellow:
yellow(rune: Rune) → {Rune}

Colors the given rune yellow (#FFEB3B).
